source.raw_text:
The Sandbag Gator Roll is a fantastic core and full-body exercise, primarily targeting the obliques, abdominals, lats, and shoulders for stabilization, while developing rotational core strength, hip mobility, and overall body tension through its challenging transverse plane movement. It's a powerful dynamic plank variation that teaches your body to control movement across different planes, improving balance and functional power. [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]  
Muscles Worked 

• Primary Movers/Stabilizers: Obliques (side abs), Transverse Abdominis, Rectus Abdominis, Latissimus Dorsi (lats), Shoulders (deltoids). 
• Supporting Muscles: Glutes, Hamstrings, Hip Flexors, Lower Back (erector spinae), and even grip muscles for maintaining tension. [1, 2, 5, 6, 7]  

Movement Pattern 

1. Starting Position: Lie on your back with feet slightly elevated, arms extended in a T-shape (one overhead, one to the side) or with the sandbag held in a specific position. 
2. The Roll (Transverse Plane): Engage your core to lift your hips and roll your body to one side, keeping your feet and hands off the floor, aiming for a controlled, twisting motion. 
3. The Stabilization: Your core muscles (especially obliques) work intensely to prevent your hips from dropping and to control the unstable, shifting weight of the sandbag. 
4. Return: Roll back to the starting position or transition to the other side, maintaining core tension throughout. [1, 2, 3, 5, 8]  

Key Benefits 

• Core & Rotational Power: Excellent for building anti-rotation strength and dynamic core stability. 
• Full Body Tension: Teaches full-body bracing and connecting upper and lower body movement. 
• Functional Strength: Mimics real-world twisting and turning movements. [1, 2, 7, 9, 10]
